This PR is a child of https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27827 and only implements the sending logic. For the rest:

* #28122 - implement the silent payments scheme
* #28202 - implements receiving
* #27827 - all three PRs together - this PR is meant for tracking progress and is useful for reviewers who want to compile all three PRs at once for testing

This PR depends on #28122 and is marked as a draft until it is merged. Commits up to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/8ee791e7b34a354ce6835b968fe12924b8908d7c belong to #28122; please review those commits on #28122

## Sending 

### Add a new `Destination` variant

The first 4 commits of this PR are a refactor to introduce a new destination type for silent payments. Both a single-use scriptPubKey and a silent payments destination have a lot in common:

* An amount
* Instructions on where to send the money (either a `scriptPubKey` or instructions for creating `scriptPubKeys`
* SFFO information

Most of the steps in creating a transaction are the same, whether it's a silent payment destination or a single scriptPubKey. Therefore, a new `Destination` std::variant is introduced which can hold either a `CRecipient` or a `V0SilentPaymentDestination`, along with functions for accessing the attributes of the underlying types using a visitor pattern.

These commits are best reviewed with something like `git diff -w --color-moved=dimmed-zebra`

### Silent Payments logic

Next, new functions are introduced for:

* Applying the Taptweak to a taproot internal private key (this is a copy-paste of the code for applying the taptweak in the signing process)
* Getting a private key from a given `scriptPubKey`
* Creating silent payment outputs (i.e. creating and using the `Sender` class from `wallet/silentpayments.h`
* Separating a vector of `Destinations` into `CRecipient` and `V0SilentPaymentDestination` vectors

Each of these functions is introduced as it's own commit. The functions are then used together to create silent payment outputs during `CreateTransactionInternal`.

### Final steps

The last commits ensure that:

* Coin selection is silent payments aware and knows to exclude taproot script path spends and inputs with unknown witness when funding a transaction which pays to a silent payment address
* The change output type is correctly chosen when paying to a silent payment address
* Functional tests
title: Silent Payments: sending
